title: Regarding champ select trollling
body:
Does the tribunal cater for champion select trolling or is the in game chat log the only evidence available?

In case you hadn't guessed I was just recently blessed with one of these fucktards refusing to support even when assigned eventually resulting in the game being a complete waste of time.

replies.body:
I believe your only option is to provide a screen capture of the evidence and submit a support ticket. 

As far as i recall the pregame lobby chat is not logged. One of the board volunteers may be able to comment further on that matter.

Pre and post game chats are logged, but are not analysed by the system and require manual review afaik. 

It also depends on what kind of trolling, if it was norms nothing can be done about it as players are expected to be mature enough to sort it out amongst themselves. Key word being "expected".

In terms of ranked champ select, it is able to be[ auto detected and is definitely bannable ](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/41se6w/riotlyte_psa_if_you_troll_and_play_a_position_you/) (Reddit post linked due to Lyte's tweets being protected). The best option is to utilise the end of game report feature (unsportsmanlike conduct with an explanation in the comments box of what happened), as consistent end game reports are the only way to ensure a player gets punished.

They wont actually get banned though.

No
In fact, Riot will turn around and go "Good job trolling, have some Hextech boxes/keys, a skin and maybe a champ for your good efforts".

Riot don't care and continue to condone the behaviour.
